jsx.ui.box
Class Tab

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.Configurable
          jsx.Source
              jsx.ui.Widget
                  jsx.ui.Box<Checkable>
                      jsx.ui.box.Tab
All Implemented Interfaces:
OnRender, OnStyle
public class Tab
extends Box<Checkable>

A base class for tab-panel widgets.

A Tab is a Box of a group of Checkables.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Constructor Detail

Tab

public Tab()

Constructs a default tab-panel.

This constructor invokes Tab(Component) with a new component created by calling Component.div() as argument.

Since:
1.0

Tab

protected Tab(Component e)

Typically constructs a frame widget.

This constructor simply invokes its super constructor with the given component as argument.

Parameters:
e - The underlying component for the tab-panel.
Since:
1.0
Method Detail

add

public boolean add(Checkable c)

Adds a checkable to this tab-panel.

The Checkable is automatically grouped with other children after added.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Overrides:
add in class Box<Checkable>
Parameters:
c - A Checkable to be added to the tab-panel.
Returns:
true if the specified @link Checkable} becomes a new child of the tab-panel; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

insert

public boolean insert(Checkable c,
                      Checkable r)

Inserts a given checkable to this tab-panel immediately before an existing child.

The Checkable is automatically grouped with other children after added.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Overrides:
insert in class Box<Checkable>
Parameters:
c - A Checkable to be inserted to the tab-panel.
r - An existing Checkable for reference.
Returns:
true if it is successfully inserted; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0

remove

public boolean remove(Checkable c)

Removes a checkable from the current tab-panel.

The Checkable is automatically ungrouped from other children after removed.

This method will force a layout for the current box if the children list has been changed.

Overrides:
remove in class Box<Checkable>
Parameters:
c - A Checkable to be removed from the tab-panel.
Returns:
true if the specified widget is successfully removed; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0
